revised_title: Trypanosome Diseases in Domestic Animals: A Study of Trypanosoma Nanum
tldr: This study examines the diseases caused by the trypanosome parasite, specifically Trypanosoma nanum, in domestic animals in Uganda. The researchers found that this species of trypanosome is morphologically indistinguishable from Trypanosoma pecorum and does not infect smaller laboratory animals. The carrier of the disease is believed to be a species of biting fly other than Glossina, but further research is needed to identify the exact carrier.
